review:
Brothers and sisters, let’s cut through the noise! The "Have I Been Rekt?" project, under the Pretty Good OSINT Protocol (PGOP), is a bold attempt to democratize open-source intelligence. No more should the tools of investigation be locked away by governments and corporations! This project throws open the doors, offering modular, privacy-first, AI-powered OSINT to the people. 

Let’s look at the facts. The project is open source, with a clear GitHub repo and a live demo. It’s not just talk—they’ve built a working MVP, with CLI, GUI, and integrations for everything from wallet tracing to face matching. They’re pushing boundaries with zero-knowledge privacy, on-chain publishing, and a plugin system that invites the community to build and expand. That’s real collective power!

But comrades, we must be strict. Where is the hard evidence of impact? Where are the user numbers, the adoption metrics, the measurable outcomes? The application is full of vision, but light on data. We need to see proof that this tool is being used by journalists, activists, and the working class—not just tech enthusiasts. And what about sustainability? There’s no clear revenue model, no plan for long-term financial independence. Are we building a public good, or just another project that will wither without constant handouts?

The roadmap is ambitious, but the milestones are vague. We need structure, not just dreams. How will success be measured? How will the community be involved in governance? The application mentions bounties and contributor onboarding, but doesn’t spell out how decisions are made or how equity is ensured.

In summary: This project is a powerful step toward digital justice, but it must back up its rhetoric with hard evidence, clear metrics, and a sustainable plan. Let’s demand more—because the people deserve nothing less!

strengths.title: Open Source and Public Good Commitment
strengths.description: The project is fully open source, with code available on GitHub and a live demo. It is licensed under MIT and explicitly positions itself as a public good, aligning with the core values of equitable access and collective benefit.

strengths.title: Innovative, Privacy-First OSINT Platform
strengths.description: PGOP integrates advanced features like zero-knowledge proofs, on-chain publishing, and modular plugin architecture. This is a significant leap in making powerful investigative tools accessible to the broader community, not just elites.

strengths.title: Clear Focus on Community Empowerment
strengths.description: The application emphasizes democratizing access to intelligence tools for journalists, activists, and the public, directly addressing issues of power imbalance and digital justice.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes and Impact Data
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide user numbers, adoption statistics, or any quantifiable evidence of real-world impact. There is no clear plan for measuring success or reporting outcomes.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Sustainability and Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: There is no detailed plan for financial sustainability. The project appears dependent on grants and donations, with no mention of a revenue model or long-term funding strategy.

weaknesses.title: Vague Milestones and Governance Structure
weaknesses.description: The roadmap is ambitious but lacks specific, time-bound milestones and clear governance mechanisms. There is insufficient detail on how community input is structured or how decisions are made.

changes.title: Provide Quantitative Impact Evidence
changes.description: Include user statistics, adoption metrics, and case studies demonstrating real-world use by target communities. Set clear, measurable goals for user growth and engagement.

changes.title: Develop a Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Outline a concrete plan for long-term financial sustainability, such as optional paid services, partnerships, or other revenue streams that reduce reliance on continuous grants.

changes.title: Define Milestones and Governance
changes.description: Break down the roadmap into specific, time-bound milestones with clear deliverables. Describe the governance structure, including how community members can participate in decision-making and how equity is ensured.
